website_summaries.verdict: These intermediate-quality guards provide non-slip protection across the spectrum of martial arts sports.
pros: High density foam with additional padding across the shin and instep
Lightweight design provides unrestricted mobility and speed
Large hook-and-loop straps for no-slip fit
Stay in place, no matter how sweaty you get
cons: Hook-and-loop straps are too short for some, so be sure to measure carefully when ordering

customer_reviews.title: These guards gave me a crazy chemical burn and rash ...
customer_reviews.text: These guards gave me a crazy chemical burn and rash that required steroid shots to get rid of. I've never had a problem with any other venum products, but these things are manufactured with some nasty chemical somewhere. I've read that some other people have had the same problem with these guards. If you buy these, only wear them for 15 min or so the first go, and see if your skin gets irritated. I wore them sparring for an hour and now I can't even put on shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: great shin guards for fighting
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards fit well and don't move around, offer good protection and are light. I use them for Krav Maga and Sparology classes. I can also say that I've compliments on them as nobody has this style in my studio. I first ordered Medium and they were too small but after I return them I ordered Large which fit perfectly. I'm 5'10, 155lb and lean; shoe size 10 and 1/2. I hope this helps somebody who wants to get the good size.
customer_reviews.author: Lucian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bang for your buck shinguards.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for sparring in Muay Thai and they are great fitting, offer excellent protection, and stay on without any need of adjustment no matter how many times I've shin checked, kicked, had my kicks caught and slipped out, and how much I was sweating. These are also incredibly light and I don't feel them slowing me down in any way. I'm 5'8" and 145 lbs. with a 30" inseam and it fits perfectly. The velcro straps do seem just a tad cheap but strong enough to hold up in sparring but at this price point these shinguards are hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Regalo

customer_reviews.title: I will be keeping this item as i need them for training ASAP but i am very disappointed in the quailty and waste of time in getting ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to order this item twice as the first item was faulty and i have unfortunately received the same of the second item again today and it is still faulty....one of the shin gaurds have been stitched together where my foot is ment to go through, so ive had to cut it myself..i have attached photos below. I will be keeping this item as i need them for training ASAP but i am very disappointed in the quailty and waste of time in getting this item.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Thin guard contour is too flat and need to tie back strap tight to fit around shin. But the back strap material is made of stiff velcro strip with sharp edge that bites into skin when tighten to fit the shin guard around the leg, and it makes too uncomfortable to wear a duration of a time. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JJ_Wataridori

customer_reviews.title: Great Shinguards!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to Muay Thai and wanted my own shinguards for practicing and sparring. After doing much research, I decided to give these a try and I fell in love. They are very comfortable and do not shift when in use as long as they are strapped properly. These shinguards offer great protection as well. Sizing chart was accurate for me and I may could have went a size small, but ordered according to the sizing guide just to be safe. For anyone who is new to Muay Thai or at an intermediate level, I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I'm 5'11" and 165 lbs
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I'm 5'11" and 165 lbs. (with skinny legs) and the Large fits perfectly with room for adjustment for people with normal size legs. The three straps around the back of the leg work very well in keeping the guards from slipping from side to side when sparring. Also, I experience no reduction in mobility at the knee and ankle as I have with other shin guards.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the price. I used to have some fairtex ones that were more expensive, but were much thicker. If your planning on doing some harder kickboxing sparring, think about spending the extra money on better ones. Overall for the money pretty good though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Snow

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for excellent protection
customer_reviews.text: My son does muay tai kickboxing and these are amazing. He was sick of the pull on shin guards. They took too long to get on and began to stink quickly. These give a sense of breathability. Great protection for tops of feet!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive shin guards, but a little thin for harder sparring
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive shin guards, but a little thin for harder sparring. If you are large and spar in a Muay Thai class, these may be a bit thin for you. They are nice and light and my kids use them, but the actual guards are only a thin single layer. For me, I get a bit bruised if I spar hard with these, I use thicker ones for sparring class. Overall a good product worth the price, just be aware of the thinner nature of the guard.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Teune

customer_reviews.title: The shin guards are hard and offer great protection. I would have preferred a single strap ...
customer_reviews.text: The shin guards are hard and offer great protection. I would have preferred a single strap on the top and bottom that extends from one side to a Velcro strip on the other side. On these there are strips on either side that meet in the middle. That makes them a little harder for me to get tighter.
customer_reviews.author: John_JT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: A little thinner than I expected but they work great. Went sparring and it took 15 minutes before any rotation on my shins (rotation is expected on any shin guards). Took 2 seconds to put them back into place and they were good until the end of the bout. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome guards but check the sizing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Medium size because it was the smallest offered, but unfortunately it was still too large. Love the brand and the padding was more than enough, just wish they had a smaller size or kids size that would work for me.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS GREAT BUT YOU HAVE TO BREAK IT IN VERY NARROW
customer_reviews.text: It isn't padded that well on the interior which sucks for something with the VENUM name on it. I've had to stretch it out but it's tricky because it's made with elastic not Velcro so I didn't want to compromise the elastic and I had to maneuver the way I could widen some of the areas so that it doesn't rub on the ankles. Might have to wear long socks with it for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Dorreann K.

customer_reviews.title: Thin and unprotective
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use in Muay Thai and when unpacking it I could tell it was cheap and flimsy. The straps could barely hold onto my leg and they do not use the hole and loop style to hold it. Its just Velcro. I’m afraid these would fly off and hit someone in the head. They’re also very thin which makes it light; but I don’t think it will offer much protection for the shin.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great Shin Pads do the trick
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about these at first since the elastic straps seemed a bit flimsy but they actually work pretty great and the pads themselves are very comfortable and very padded. They seem to hug the shin and do not slide around as much as pads I've had in the past. Great pads from a great brand. And I am a professional fighter, for what it's worth, and these are great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy J

customer_reviews.title: Best shinguards on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have large calfs and I was concerned about fit with a firm guard. These work great. They have just enough padding to protect my legs but they aren't so soft that they are sloppy and ineffective like many others. On the outside and the lining they feel consistent with my favorite gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shin guards. Great for kickboxing/ sparring. I train kickboxing and Muay Thai, and work on the heavy bag. These shin guards are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice pads
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable, easy on and off and stay in place
customer_reviews.author: Lindyloowho

customer_reviews.title: I love these, the only thing is that the straps ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I love these, the only thing is that the straps in the back are a little janky. I put some tape on them so the velcro siding wouldn't grind into the back of my legs, or wear compression pants. I've had these for a couple months now, they are not super padded, but padded enough, which helps you when you're getting you kicks checked, it forces you to set up your strikes better. They also don't really slide off my shin too often like previous pads.
customer_reviews.author: Steph SS

customer_reviews.title: pretty good for the price.  = )
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. They break in pretty quick. I've only been doing Muay Thai for about three months and for my first pair of shin guards I'm quite happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does it job
customer_reviews.text: Still using them after a year Little rip in the front bottom and velcro is not sticking like it use to. Could be my fault because I go hard and sweat even harder!
customer_reviews.author: Anisha

customer_reviews.title: Very good shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Thick padding offers much more padding than the other brands. I had a pair of Hyabusa shin guards that were ok but when I got these and sparred with them I realized how poor the padding on the other brand really was. If you're looking for good foot and shin padding for kickboxing I recommend these. I'm 6'2 and the large fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Beall

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and feel. Don’t get out of place easy and my weight has fluctuated dramatically while I’ve owned these. Had them and used 3 days a week approx for a year and a half, still going strong and doesn’t look like that’s changing anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: Adil

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: I didn't own these for more than 3 months before the faux leather was ripped in the foot area. They are more comfortable than my previous shin guards, but disappointing durability. They were used twice weekly in Muy Thai/MMA class.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not leg specific
customer_reviews.text: Not leg specific so it sits on the foot strangely. otherwise good product for price
customer_reviews.author: Name

customer_reviews.title: the black on black look good. I got a med and they are small ...
customer_reviews.text: They are okay, the black on black look good. I got a med and they are small as hell. they don't go over my toes and barely reach the bottom of my knee. I'm 5'7 so they should have fit. The cushioning is fine for intermediate or beginner. If you can get a better brand with the loop rings in back. The velcro on these is poor and can scratch you or your training partner *Edit - Jut to be clear i train Muay Thai with 3 years experience. These shin guards take a beating and work just okay
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great guards
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. Looks slick. I look very stylish while kicking my opponents in the head.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Sturgill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect provided the right amount of padding and were not to bulky true to size based on sizing chart.
customer_reviews.author: Me.Pandoni

customer_reviews.title: What a Steal
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on sale for $35 and have zero complaints - held up well during sparring and were comfortable throughout.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: digs into your toes
customer_reviews.text: The foam padding covers 95% of the foot so the tips of your toes are visible. That means the edge of the padding digs into your toes and that's annoying. The shinguard portion fits fine and the velcro straps don't dig into your ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chong

customer_reviews.title: They look good & useable
customer_reviews.text: Little brother with kids in Karate. Hasn't given me good feedback on these. I think they are cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great shin guards, not a lot of padding but who even cares about that, we're fighters lol. Fits good and is nice and secure around my skinny Muay Thai legs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great pads
customer_reviews.text: Good quality padding. They do have a few crappy stitches, buy they are handmade in Thailand!
customer_reviews.author: Roxy Pancakes

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: i love these shin guards. they are made well and feel good when i spar or just kick the heavy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Mimila

customer_reviews.title: Beware if u have big feet
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this item, but my toes stick out and keep getting bruised. I wish the foot guard was longer to protect big feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: I like the shin guards, they offer very good protection. The only thing I don't like is that I can't use them with my shoes on. They work only on bare foot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Great shin guards. I wish I had gotten one size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Smith

customer_reviews.title: They cover shins and feet really good but still can move no problem
customer_reviews.text: Fits well...I'm 5'8'' and got medium. They cover shins and feet really good but still can move no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Too light
customer_reviews.text: Not really durable. You can feel even the lightest kicks
customer_reviews.author: Jaison Joykutty

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price but if you can stretch your budget for the top of the line Venum, I would do that.
customer_reviews.author: VG2013

customer_reviews.title: Quality item
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, don't slip too often even in full contact sparring. Saving my shins one kick and check at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Bell

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, I probably should have seen if there is ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, I probably should have seen if there is a smaller size, I'm 5'3 and this goes almost passed my toes.
customer_reviews.author: REBECCA

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I returned these. Much smaller and thinner than I had hoped for. Spent a couple extra dollars to buy the Combat Corner shin guards my gym sells.
customer_reviews.author: heather williams

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product. Used for 2 days maybe I’ll update in 30days . However for the money , it’s solid and will work for long days
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Harrold

customer_reviews.title: These fit as described and work great. The padding works well to absorb the shock ...
customer_reviews.text: These fit as described and work great. The padding works well to absorb the shock of kicking others and heavy bags.
customer_reviews.author: RickAndMortyFan_c-137

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Totally satisfied-looks good and does not slip out of place.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Beginner kickboxer and holding up and protecting me very well.
customer_reviews.author: David Vanbogelen

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable im 5'4 bought medium
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable im 5'4 bought medium. Used them for sparring. They actually stay in place unlike other thai shin guards
customer_reviews.author: gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Good looking product and does what they are suppose to do.
customer_reviews.author: shawn h.

customer_reviews.title: dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: over priced and very poor quality. spend just a little more money and go with a quality brand
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Shin guards good
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price, just know there are better shin guards out there
customer_reviews.author: Trevor duffles

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and affordable! Shin guards of choice for Muay Thai
customer_reviews.text: Love it, if you are somewhat tall, order the large ones.
customer_reviews.author: David Esau

customer_reviews.title: Venue ankle support.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good produce for the price point. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nightsky

customer_reviews.title: Everything about these are perfect
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a pair of shin guards to fit me Im 6'2 168lbs
customer_reviews.author: jeremy lucas

customer_reviews.title: ... slightly longer legs than average and the mediums fit great. Straps hold with no issues during drills
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9'' with slightly longer legs than average and the mediums fit great. Straps hold with no issues during drills. They are also comfortable to keep on when I'm not actively kicking/checking.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Osterhage

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I think there perfect they fit super nicely for its price there super worth it
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I love Venum products
customer_reviews.author: Dorin

customer_reviews.title: Shin Gaurds
customer_reviews.text: They were what I expected a little long in the toes but overall good quality
customer_reviews.author: Donald K.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many different brands of shin guards and tested them out and all of them have not been as good as the venom challenger shin guards. These shin guards are very comfortable around your leg, don't feel bulky and heavy, and gives you good maneuverability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it !
customer_reviews.text: Once they’re on they feel like they’re not 😊 I have total control. I like this product
customer_reviews.author: goce trpevski

customer_reviews.title: Discount
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but I see more of this more affordable can I have some discount
customer_reviews.author: Walter carranza

customer_reviews.title: Easy to slip on and comfortable to spar with
customer_reviews.text: Easy to slip on and comfortable to spar with. Doesn't really cover my toes though, so a misplaced kick can definitely cause some serious toe bruising
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. Excellent quality and the item arrived before ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Excellent quality and the item arrived before it was supposed to. The only problem is that it is a little bit smaller than they say. I could have bought the XL that it would fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Magno Parreiras de Sousa

customer_reviews.title: product needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: the shinguards did not meet my expectation because 2 straps attached to shinguards ripped half way off... the straps need better sewing or stronger threads
customer_reviews.author: marcellus bryant

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: cut into my skin on the foot in several locations
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: Great shin guards!
customer_reviews.text: They protect my legs great during training, easy to move in, and fit well. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: James LaMay

customer_reviews.title: ... come in handy especially when your taking martial arts great for sparring
customer_reviews.text: This really come in handy especially when your taking martial arts great for sparring
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like it very much
customer_reviews.text: Like it very much. Its light weighted and easy to put them on. It does a good job to protect my shins during the sparring with my Krav Maga training. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as thick as I expected, no real foot protection
customer_reviews.author: Collin Hewes

customer_reviews.title: Shop here
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards are just what i need...great buy for the price. ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good solid product not complaints, They fit better than my last pair of cheaper Shin guards
customer_reviews.author: mike lleras

customer_reviews.title: these shin guards seem really high quality, i just ...
customer_reviews.text: these shin guards seem really high quality, i just received them today and have not gotten to try drilling with them yet, but as i tried them on, they seem a little bit small. I am 5'8, between 130-135 pounds, and they seem a little small for me. Any chance I could return them and get 1 size bigger? EDIT: after spending many months with these, they are really nice, and feel good. my coach assured me that these are in fact a good size for someone like myself. (i am now 143 pounds) good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C

customer_reviews.title: Good for your dollar!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I use them for light sparring and they do the job. Just like just like anything else, you take care of them and they will last you a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Loco foo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These shin guards are great protection and when you kick, they do not turn, they stay in place due to the ankle supporter on them. Although these are great, the foot area is a little bit too long than I prefer, but they do not cover my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Right for Some/Great Return Experience
customer_reviews.text: I actually retuned these. They are very stiff, which might appeal to some. They are also very narrow on the calves so if you have larger leg muscles, you may not enjoy these. I also would have liked for them to cover the foot completely to avoid accidental toe-nail scratches. VERY well made, impressive. The return process went very well.
customer_reviews.author: FitFun

customer_reviews.title: and I think it's safe to say they're pretty decent quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine about six months now, and I think it's safe to say they're pretty decent quality. I use mine for Krav, and the elastics are all holding up just fine, with no signs of tearing or loss of stretchiness. I regularly wipe mine down with lysol solution, and the finishes seems to be holding up just fine. They don't seem to be deteriorating or flaking or anything like that from the cleaning solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It met all of my expectations and preserves my shins.
customer_reviews.author: richard t. ratcliff

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 6'6" MMA fighter boyfriend, and he loves them! Says they're one of the best pairs he's owned, and they're a good price. Recommend them for sure.
customer_reviews.author: e1n2m3

customer_reviews.title: Crappy velcro ruins the product
customer_reviews.text: Good padding and fits well but the velcro is Sheiss. Already coming undone on me and I've barely put them through any serious training. Would have been a solid product if not for this. Spend the extra money and go for the higher quality venum shin guards or just buy hayabusa instead.
customer_reviews.author: Becker

customer_reviews.title: They provide great protection but the quality of the stitching is terrible ...
customer_reviews.text: After two months of minimal use, the straps and stitching is already starting to come off. They provide great protection but the quality of the stitching is terrible and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Light Sparring
customer_reviews.text: It took me a couple days to get used to wearing them, but they fit great and do the job needed. We do light sparring with them and they are thick enough to protect you, but thin enough that you feel it a little. For me it is the perfect balance.
customer_reviews.author: CRobby22

customer_reviews.title: They generally work and if I were kicking barefoot they'd work great. so 4 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: The straps for the feet don't quite work for me since I want to wear shoes but whatever. They generally work and if I were kicking barefoot they'd work great. so 4 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Be_wil_derd

customer_reviews.title: Great shinguards for sparring.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for Krav Maga sparring. Great fit, don't slide around, strong material. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Not bad considering the price paid. They are a decent quality and they fit ok. We'll have to see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: cz

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Really like these for the price not half bad, must take very good care of them however if you don't want the logo and letters to peel off because it is not real leather, so they won't last as long as leather made gloves.
customer_reviews.author: dara

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this product. So far I've used it about 10 times in sparring sessions and it doesn't move or wiggle around. They have an awesome leather padding, haven't feel the hits since I've been wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Fabrizio

customer_reviews.title: But seemed to be made decently but I didn't like the matching gloves so I returned
customer_reviews.text: They were ok in fit. But seemed to be made decently but I didn't like the matching gloves so I returned them
customer_reviews.author: T Guerra

customer_reviews.title: I am A bigger fan of the RDX shin pads ...
customer_reviews.text: I am A bigger fan of the RDX shin pads with the extra layer of gel padding that the RDX makes them with. absorbing kicks is nicer along with being able to kick harder. my shins are not as sore with the rdx pads. only con to the rdx pads is the gel pad only covers %80 of the shin.
customer_reviews.author: Evalyn

customer_reviews.title: Excelent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Using it,you could training withoudlt fear. It protects you, avoiding any ensure . itsvmaterial is excellent. Approved !
customer_reviews.author: Thiago Barbosa Lima de Moura

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not very thick when compared to other similarly priced shin guards used for Muay thai.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy R.

customer_reviews.title: Just a sensitive guy?
customer_reviews.text: These gave me crazy horrible rashes that required medical care. I washed the heck out of them and tried again, needed to refill prescription. I have gotten dermatitis from tattoos so maybe I'm sensitive though. Oh my wife says yes I'm definitely too sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Alec and Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shin guard
customer_reviews.text: I'd give these a ZERO, but there's no option to do so. Very nice shin guard. I said "GUARD", not guards, because they sent me one. ONE!! Not a pair, but ONE SHIN GUARD!! SERIOUSLY??!!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The shinguards wear nice. The straps are not irritable that I've noticed while sparring. They've done well.
customer_reviews.author: PhilipLee

customer_reviews.title: Easy. You can even work in the stalls
customer_reviews.text: Hello everyone! Come well. Easy. You can even work in the stalls. Greetings from Shin!))
customer_reviews.author: Pavel

product_meta.title: Venum Challenger Standup Shinguards
product_meta.description: The perfect lightweight performance shin guards for all levels. Venum is a Mixed Martial Arts & related combat sports brand designed for the professional athlete, amateur competitor and hardcore fan. Our passion for Mixed Martial Arts combined with our technical expertise allows us to create innovative training equipment and lifestyle apparel. Venum products are widely recognized as the best training equipment in the industry.
feature_bullets: High density foam with additional padding across the shin and instep

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
